title: Tom Brady ‘was supposed’ to play for Raiders upon leaving Patriots, Las Vegas owner Mark Davis said
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Tom Brady nearly joined the Las Vegas Raiders as quarterback in 2020, but team management decided against signing him.
Mark Davis confirmed Brady's near-signing, later leading to Brady acquiring a minority ownership stake in the Raiders in 2023.
The NFL amended rules in 2025, allowing Brady to attend production meetings as a FOX commentator despite his Raiders ownership.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: "Friendship" with Tim Robinson and Paul Rudd is now streaming on HBO Max.
"Highest 2 Lowest" by Spike Lee and Denzel Washington is available on Apple TV+.
"Lilo & Stitch" live-action remake is streaming on Disney+.

title: What Jakobi Meyers and the Raiders are saying about the Patriots ahead of season opener
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: The Patriots will face the Raiders, with former Patriots WR Jakobi Meyers and coach Pete Carroll returning to Foxborough.
Pete Carroll, now Raiders head coach, highlighted the Patriots' strong running game and front seven as key elements.
Jakobi Meyers expressed mixed emotions about returning to Foxborough and uncertainty regarding his trade request.

title: Jaylen Brown gives his own take on Boston Tea Party in stream with IShowSpeed
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jaylen Brown and YouTuber IShowSpeed streamed a tour of Boston, re-enacting the Boston Tea Party by dumping tea.
During the stream, Brown raced IShowSpeed in Downtown Crossing, with IShowSpeed narrowly winning but injuring his hamstring.
Brown has been active in streaming, having launched his Twitch channel 'FCHWPO' and previously collaborated with Kyrie Irving.

title: Dante Scarnecchia likes what he sees from Patriots rookie Will Campbell
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots rookie Will Campbell, chosen 4th in 2025 NFL Draft, will start at left tackle against the Raiders.
Dante Scarnecchia praises Campbell's dynamic run blocking and competitive spirit despite concerns about arm length.
Campbell ranked high in preseason with Pro Football Focus, scoring 80.1 in pass blocking and 87.6 in run blocking.

title: ‘That’s their prerogative’: Mike Vrabel responds to Bill Belichick’s ban on Patriots scouts at UNC
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots coach Mike Vrabel responded to UNC's ban on New England scouts, emphasizing finding alternate ways to gather player information.
UNC, led by new coach Bill Belichick, barred Patriots scouts due to a reportedly strained relationship with Patriots owner Robert Kraft.
Belichick's college debut ended in a 48-14 loss, marking a shaky start after his NFL coaching career and resulting in a Patriots ban.

title: Woman who was allegedly filmed in the shower at URI is suing the school
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: A female University of Rhode Island student is suing the school, claiming she was filmed in a unisex dorm shower.
The lawsuit alleges URI's lack of privacy protections led to the incident and defamed her in media statements.
The accused man, James Paquette, is facing a state charge of video voyeurism; URI has not commented on the lawsuit.

title: Christian Gonzalez to miss Patriots’ season opener, Will Campbell questionable vs. Raiders
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Christian Gonzalez will miss the Patriots' opener against the Raiders due to a hamstring injury.
Patriots coach Mike Vrabel lists Will Campbell as questionable with an ankle injury for Sunday's season opener.
The Patriots' secondary features changes, including the absence of Jabrill Peppers and the addition of Carlton Davis.

title: Jayson Tatum’s Celtics teammate has a positive update on star’s recovery from Achilles tear
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Celtics forward Jayson Tatum is making progress in his recovery from a ruptured Achilles tendon, teammate Jordan Walsh reports.
No definitive timeline is set for Tatum's return, with Celtics prioritizing full readiness and health before resuming play.
Tatum has been seen without a boot, working at Boston's practice facility; recovery timeline remains uncertain for the season.

title: 5 things to know about the Raiders ahead of Sunday’s matchup against the Patriots
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots face Raiders in Week 1, with Tom Brady starting his first full season as a minority owner of the Raiders.
Raiders have new head coach Pete Carroll and quarterback Geno Smith, who had a 17-15 record with Seahawks in 2022-2023.
Raiders' Ashton Jeanty, picked sixth in the NFL draft, is favored to win Offensive Rookie of the Year over Titans' Cam Ward.
